page.title: 04THE FIRE STATION
page.content: The Fire Station The fire station was built in 1967.The fire men have about 90 calls a year.The station is run by the Norfolk County Council with money from the rate payers.There are eleven firemen.They attend about fifteen road accidents a year.All fire men live within one mile of Methwold. After a call-out the men only have three minutes to get to the station before the fire engine leaves.The equipment on the fire engine includes: pump;hose;cutting equipment;five hundred of water.The fire engine attended an aircraft crash in the forest near Brandon recently.Twenty five tenders were needed to help.
